Text: I got tired of reading comments about people who were handed bad activation keys, and calling in to find out they were black listed.  This works every time, and I have never had a problem with updates or anything else.  It is beautiful!

I believe it does.  I never upgraded, but installed to scratch, perhaps you should google this.  I am sure if you do an upgrade all of you files will be saved.  If it doesn't do applications it should give you a list of applications in a shortcut on your desktop that you need to re-install.  BTW, logging in with a Microsoft account poses no problem.

When I look whats in the files I only see the ISO where would happen to be the support/windows permanent activator or would you have to open the iso say with 7zip or DAEMON?

You burn the iso to your DVD or other media so that you can install Windows 8.  Once you do that all of the folders and files can be readily accessed.  Of course, you can always open the iso file with whatever extraction program you have such as winrar or 7zip.  In Windows 8 you can do this natively without any third party software.
I put the activation files in the iso image so that when the DVD was created they could be easily run from the DVD.  It minimizes the chances of loss.

There was something on the microsoft webpage about this issue happening when i try to install windows 8 without having windows 7 installed first. Is this torrent for an upgrade from windows 7 or can i use it to install windows 8 as a whole new operating system on a blank drive (as I wanted to)?

As Always I installed this OS onto a reformatted disk.  I never upgrade.  Ensure you run these files as an administrator.  I test all sorts of software, so I re-install from scratch every so often.  I have NEVER had a problem with activation, and I always do so with the internet connected, using my Microsoft account, and BEFORE I update.  This is just MY experience.

thank you very much for the link. I did had a clean install, but am confused don't know how to activate it please. First of all, how do I even log in as an administrator? Can you give me a link to the microsoft support site you meant. I guess I do a lot more better when given instructions in details please

You right-click the mouse and choose run as administrator.  As far as creating a microsoft account you can access the instructions here:  http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-live/sign-up-create-account-how
